DOCNAME: CASE OF KARAKAŞ AND YEŞİLIRMAK v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 6-1;No violation of Art. 6-2;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date police officers from the anti - terror branch of ORG reported that an illegal organisation , namely PERSON ( NORP Left ) , would organise a demonstration in front of the head office of a DATE journal , namely PERSON , on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants , together with CARDINAL other people , were arrested in front of the newspaper ’s head office and taken to police custody at ORG . According to the arrest report drafted by the police , PERSON members were arrested following a chase and CARDINAL warning shots . It was also noted that the police officers made the detainees lie on the floor and collected the pamphlets and banners that they carried .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG provided an expert report where it concluded that PERSON handwriting matched the writing on several of the banners seized by the police .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were examined by a doctor from ORG . The doctor reported bruises on one hand of the first applicant and on both hands of the second applicant . The report stated that the applicants’ injuries did not constitute a danger to life , but would prevent them from working for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a press conference on the subject of the apprehension of members of the ORG organisation . There is no information in the case - file as to whether any declaration was made by the police during the conference . However , DATE the applicants’ names and pictures appeared in CARDINAL national newspapers , namely ORG , where they were described as members of the ORG organisation .
CARDINAL . The news in the PERSON newspaper , with the headline “ CARDINAL members of PERSON arrested ” , read as follows :

“ The members of ORG organisation , namely ... , PERSON , PERSON , ... , who were getting ready to hold a demonstration in PERSON , in order to protest against the PERSON newspaper , have been arrested . The police seized the following items from the accused : pamphlets and banners with slogans against journalists , publications with leftist points of view , and slings to smash the windows of the PERSON building . ”

CARDINAL . The information in the PERSON newspaper , with the headline “ Protesters with slings ” , was accompanied by a photo , in which a group of accused was standing behind a table on which pamphlets , banners and rubber bands were displayed . The text was as follows :

“ The police arrested CARDINAL people , ( including QUANTITY women ) , who were allegedly members of an illegal leftist organisation and were getting ready to hold a demonstration to protest about an article that was published in PERSON newspaper . The police seized banners , pamphlets , and rubber bands for slings which were found on the accused , namely ... GPE , PERSON ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were brought before ORG and then before a non - presiding judge at ORG , where they denied all charges . Both applicants rejected their statements given in police custody , contending that they had been forced to sign them . The court ordered their detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were examined by the prison doctor . The medical report indicated the presence of bruises on the right hand of the first applicant . Moreover a site of scarred tissue , MONEY QUANTITY in dimension , was identified on the back of his right hand .

At the end of the examination of the second applicant the doctor reported the presence of bruises on both hands and CARDINAL sites of scarred tissue , each approximately QUANTITY in dimension on the back of his left hand .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed a bill of indictment , charging the applicants under LAW of LAW with aiding and abetting an illegal organisation . The summary of the relevant parts of the indictment provided as follows :

“ ... In view of the accused ’s statements given at different stages of the criminal proceedings , the arrest report , the house search and seizure reports , the seized pamphlets , banners and slings which were found on the accused at the time of arrest , the expert report and the content of the case file , it has been established that :

CARDINAL . The accused PERSON was a supporter of the ideology of the illegal ORG organisation ... , DATE he started to visit the head office of the PERSON ( NORP Youth ) periodical in ORG , together with his friend PERSON ... , he was informed of the demonstration that was going to be held in front of the NORP building , on DATE , by a person who approached him while he was reading the GPE ( Struggle ) periodical in a public park .
He assisted in the preparation of banners . ... According to ORG report dated DATE the characteristics of the applicant ’s handwriting were visible on CARDINAL banners .

CARDINAL . NORP ... the accused PERSON was a supporter of the ideology of the illegal ORG organisation . He was a reader of the PERSON periodical . He met with his friend PERSON in PERSON and they arrived together at the scene of the incident . When he was arrested the police seized CARDINAL banners which he was carrying . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE a doctor at ORG examined the second and the first applicant respectively . The medical report reiterated the findings of the reports dated DATE and indicated that the first applicant complained of pain in his waist and the second applicant complained of pain in his thighs .

CARDINAL . At the first hearing held on DATE before ORG , the applicants submitted the medical reports and written statements in which they alleged to have been subjected to torture in police custody . They did not give any details concerning their allegations of torture . They also maintained that , in police custody , they had been forced to sign statements before reading them . The court ordered the applicants’ release pending trial .

CARDINAL . At the hearing dated DATE ORG decided that the police officers whose signatures appeared under the applicants’ written statements given in police custody should be summoned to appear before the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the police officers confirmed before the court the content of the applicants’ police statements and the authenticity of their signatures appearing on the bottom of these statements .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in view of the incident report , the witness statements , the seized banners , pamphlets and the content of the case - file , the court decided to acquit CARDINAL of the accused and convicted CARDINAL of them , including the applicants , under LAW and LAW . It sentenced the applicants to DATE and QUANTITY months’ and DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ lawyer lodged an appeal with ORG . In the petition the lawyer repeated the allegation that the applicants had been subjected to torture in police custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the hearing which took place before ORG , the applicants repeated their allegations of torture in police custody and pleaded not guilty .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG in respect of CARDINAL of the accused , including the applicants , and quashed it in respect of CARDINAL of them . It quashed the decision regarding CARDINAL of the accused on procedural grounds and the other CARDINAL on account of lack of evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the ORG request to rectify the decision .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Criminal Code provides :

“ Any person , who knowing that an armed gang or organisation is illegal , assists it , harbours its members , provides it with food , weapons ammunition or clothes or facilitates its operations in any manner whatsoever shall be sentenced to not CARDINAL and not more than five years’ imprisonment ... ”

CARDINAL . DATE ( Law no . ORG of CARDINAL DATE ) provides that the offence defined in LAW of LAW is classified in the category of “ acts committed to further the purposes of terrorism ” . According to LAW , penalties laid down in LAW as punishment for the offences defined under LAW are increased by CARDINAL .
